title: Identification of Multipotent Stem Cells in Human Brain Tissue Following Stroke
patient: The second case (Case 2, ) was an 81-year-old female admitted to a local hospital where she received endovascular thrombectomy for right middle cerebral artery occlusion. Partial reperfusion (thrombolysis in cerebral infarction scale 2A) was obtained by endovascular thrombectomy. On day 4 after treatment, brain CT showed a large bilateral low-density area and right hemorrhagic transformation. She was transported to our hospital and received decompressive craniotomy and partial lobectomy 5 days after ischemic onset. Postoperative CT revealed that the surgery was successful (; Supplementary Data are available online at ).
